in Whirlpool Corporation v. Registrar of Trademarks, Mumbai1, where it was held:

However,  the  alternative  remedy  has  been  consistently  held  by  this  Court  not  to
operate as a bar in at least three contingencies, namely: (i) where the writ petition has
been  filed  for  the  enforcement  of  any  of  the  fundamental  rights;  (ii)  where  there  has
been  a  violation  of  the  principles  of  natural  justice;  or  (iii)  where  the  order  or
proceedings are wholly without jurisdiction or the vires of an Act is challenged.”
